instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_FAN_0_CTL: What is SMC_FAN_0_CTL? SMC_FAN_0_CTL is a line between the SMC and the fan that controls fan speed that is frequently disturbed when someone inexperienced knocks resistors in the area off with their fingernail or screwdriver when unplugging the fan. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spinning problem
threads.message:
This board is back after a few months, with a new <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR> it was working fine and now the problem is back, we have tried different <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR> and the problem is persistent, any ideas? 
the voltages:
Pin1: 5.1v
Pin2: 1.63v
Pin3: 4,62v

This was the original thread:
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/14618-solved-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a-fan-spinning-very-fast[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spinning problem
threads.message: Directly fast on startup? ASD error? <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spinning problem
threads.message:
No Title

<SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> is 3.3v and ASD errors are attached in the picture and yes directly on startup

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spinning problem
threads.message: Diode mode on <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> fan disconnected of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spinning problem
threads.message: It's 0 between <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> and ground in diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spinning problem
threads.message: Well there shouldn't be a short to GND there! Not much on that line besides the SMC that can cause this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spinning problem
